title: Drawing, "Studies of Wild Azalea and Dogwood", early 20th century
medium: Brush and watercolor on coarse gray paper
inscribed: recto: S. L. Crownfield (inscribed by her sister, Gertrude)
creditline: Gift of Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney
description: Vertical sheet depicting white and pink wild azalea blossoms with green foliage.  On verso, sprays of white and pink dogwood.  Mounted so that the verso is displayed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Studies of Wild Azalea and Dogwood", early 20th century.
early 20th century. Brush and watercolor on coarse gray paper. Gift of Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney. 1937-59-15.
